description: Executes the fit of a specified machine learning model based on training data. The model type and corresponding parameters can be provided to configure the fitting process.

parameters.name: model_name
parameters.description: The name of the machine learning model to fit. This could be any algorithm such as `random_forest`, `logistic_regression`, `svm`, etc.

parameters.name: training_set
parameters.description: The training set for the machine learning model, provided as a vector data cube. This set contains both the independent variables and dependent variable that the model will analyze to learn patterns and relationships.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The dimension in the training set that represents the dependent variable for classification or regression tasks.

parameters.name: model_parameters
parameters.description: A dictionary of parameters specific to the selected model. These parameters will vary depending on the model chosen. For example, `max_depth`, `num_trees` for Random Forest, or `penalty`, `C` for Logistic Regression.

parameters.name: random_state
parameters.description: A randomization seed to use for model training. This ensures reproducibility of results when a seed is provided. If not given or `null`, no seed is used and results may differ on subsequent use.

returns.description: A model object that can be saved with ``save_ml_model()`` and restored with ``load_ml_model()``.
